identificationModule.briefTitle: Mechanisms of Stroke in Intracranial Stenosis
identificationModule.officialTitle: Mechanisms of Stroke in Intracranial Stenosis and Stenting

statusModule.whyStopped: The affiliated study SAMMPRIS (Stenting and Aggressive Medical Management for Preventing Recurrent stroke in Intracranial Stenosis) has stopped enrollment.

responsibleParty.investigatorTitle: Associate Professor of Neurology. Director of Cerebrovascular Division

collaborators.name: National Institute of Neurological Disorders and Stroke (NINDS)

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The objective of this SAMMPRIS-affiliated study is to understand the mechanisms the mechanisms that underlie ischemic stroke recurrence in high-grade intracranial atherosclerotic disease in order to determine predictors of recurrent stroke. MoSIS will evaluate 6 specific mechanisms of stroke in the medically-treated SAMMPRIS cohort: decreased antegrade flow, progression of stenosis, decreased proximal collateral flow, decreased distal collateral flow, impaired cerebrovascular reserve, and artery-to-artery embolism.

keywords: Symptomatic intracranial atherosclerotic disease enrolled in the medical arm of SAMMPRIS

primaryOutcomes.measure: Ischemic stroke in the territory of the stenotic artery

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Enrolled in the medical arm of SAMMPRIS, signed consent

Exclusion Criteria:

* For QMRA testing: contraindications to MRI; for TCD testing, abscence of ultrasonographic windows.
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Medical arm of the SAMMPRIS trial which includes recently symptomatic (\<30 days) high grade (70% or more)intracranial stenosis of the carotid, middle cerebral, vertebral or basilar arteries.
